metadata.title: CVE-2023-24531 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Command go env is documented as outputting a shell script containing the Goenvironment. However, go env doesn't sanitize values, so executing itsoutput as a shell script can cause various bad bahaviors, includingexecuting arbitrary commands or inserting new environment variables. Thisissue is relatively minor because, in general, if an attacker can setarbitrary environment variables on a system, they have better attackvectors than making "go env" print them out.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-24531` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.18 - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4+esm1
golang-1.18-go - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4+esm1
golang-1.18-src - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: golang-1.8 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.9 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.10 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.13 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.16 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
golang-1.18 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4+esm1').
